name: HR Manager
description:
HR Manager

In this role, you have the opportunity to be part of international HR team and acting as a HR partner for Enabling Functions in Russia, Central Asia and CEE countries. As an HR Manager you will provide comprehensive HR support and strategic HR advice to the organization and help drive transformation efforts.

You are responsible for

  • Implementation and execution of our people strategy with HRBP, management and other stakeholders (Centers of expertise, PPS);
  • Providing strategic advice to people managers on people-related issues. Challenging the business - as appropriate - in order to ensure integrated people and talent strategies, and fair people management approaches;
  • Driving Strategic Workforce Planning, Performance Management, Talent Management, Employee Engagement and other Philips people processes and initiatives to continually improve organizational effectiveness and required skill set upgrades in business;
  • Working closely with the business to understand and address business issues and supports department’s organization design, local organizational capabilities development with HR interventions;
  • Managing / supporting local industrial / labor relations activities, if applicable;
  • Driving standardization in the execution of HR policies and processes;
  • Supporting and facilitating the development of managers in people management and manager self-service;
  • Participation in HR-projects on a country/market level;

To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience

  • Bachelor’s degree in a related field (such as human resources, psychology, economics);
  • 10 years of relevant working experience in HR Manager/ Partner role dealing with operational HR matters within a complex and dynamic business context characterized by different cultures, management styles, systems and procedures;
  • Experience in operational implementation of the HR strategy through day-today execution of HR activities;
  • Practice in making business decisions that align with organizational goals;
  • Experience in managing stakeholders;
  • Experience in planning, coordinating, executing, and evaluating projects;
  • Pro-active attitude, strong analytical and communication & presentation skills;
  • Fluent English is a must.
